article.title: Testing the electroweak phase transition in scalar extension models at lepton colliders

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the operator O_R, defined as |H|^2 |DH|^2, reduce to after applying the equation of motion of the Higgs boson field?
choices: μ²|H|^4 + O_H + Σ_(f) (Y_u O_u + h.c.) - Σ_(d) (Y_d O_d + h.c.) + Σ_(e) (Y_e O_e + h.c.)
μ²|H|^4 - O_H + 1/2 O_6 + Σ_(f) (Y_u O_u + h.c.) + Σ_(d) (Y_d O_d + h.c.) + Σ_(e) (Y_e O_e + h.c.)

multiple_choice_question.text: What are the constraints on the coefficient c_6 of the dimension-6 operator |H|^6 at one-loop level, considering both the strong first-order phase transition (SFOPT) and vacuum stability conditions?
How is the deviation of the cross section of Zh production, denoted as δσ(Zh), defined in the context of this article?
In the SU(2) triplet scalar extension model, what is the approximate expression for the coefficient -c_6, which primarily controls the SFOPT condition?
